Articles.Content:
Is this going to work in 0.25 cuz it's made in 0.23.5?http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/78852-Want-to-go-to-Eve-and-back-Try-this

Edited November 21, 2014 by Cannon

Off hand I don't see any of the parts that have been altered in the last 2 versions, so I think it should work.

EDIT: Oops, I see one but you can fix it easy. You need to swap out the resized SAS module.
Turn off destructible buildings or the launch pad will blow up when you place your Eve rocket on it. Everything else with the exception of the small SAS part will be fine.

I'm not sure that even the resized SAS will be an actual PROBLEM. I had one of those on a ship in transit when 0.25 arrived. (We'd gotten the heads-up to return/recover all spaceplanes, but I hadn't seen anything about the SAS.) It was even an important structural part in the middle of the craft. And...it looked really weird, with all the parts attached to it just FLOATING like that, seemingly unattached to anything. But it worked fine. The craft went through reentry and landing and everything with no problem. (For which Bob is very VERY thankful!)

I'm not sure that even the resized SAS will be an actual PROBLEM. I had one of those on a ship in transit when 0.25 arrived. (We'd gotten the heads-up to return/recover all spaceplanes, but I hadn't seen anything about the SAS.) It was even an important structural part in the middle of the craft. And...it looked really weird, with all the parts attached to it just FLOATING like that, seemingly unattached to anything. But it worked fine. The craft went through reentry and landing and everything with no problem. (For which Bob is very VERY thankful!)

The reason that works is because the attachments and attachment nodes are all stored in the persistance file, but the texture is not. New ones will not attach like that but ones already out there still think the old nodes are correct. You are correct, the old nodes won't hurt the craft any in stock. Might cause aero issues in FAR though.
